title: Sharing Opinions
subtitle: Express what you think and why
objectives: Give reasons to support your views

keyPhrases.context: 자신의 의견을 제시할 때 가장 기본적인 표현

example.A: What do you think about working from home?
example.B: In my opinion, it increases productivity for most people.

keyPhrases.commonMistakes: 'I believe to...'가 아닌 'I believe that...'이 맞음

example.A: Do you think the project will succeed?
example.B: I believe that we have a good chance if we work together.

example.A: Why do you prefer this option?
example.B: The reason is that it saves both time and money.

keyPhrases.pronunciation: /frʌm maɪ pɔɪnt əv vjuː/ 프럼 마이 포인트 어브 뷰
keyPhrases.context: 자신의 시각에서 바라본 의견을 말할 때

example.A: How should we handle this situation?
example.B: From my point of view, we need more data before deciding.

keyPhrases.pronunciation: /aɪ wʊd seɪ ðæt/ 아이 우드 세이 댓

example.B: I would say that it carries some risk, but it could pay off.

example.A: What's your take on the new policy?
example.B: Personally, I think it will benefit everyone in the long run.

keyPhrases.pronunciation: /æz fɑːr æz aɪm kənˈsɜːrnd/ 애즈 파 애즈 아임 컨선드

example.A: Should we proceed with the merger?
example.B: As far as I'm concerned, the benefits outweigh the risks.

keyPhrases.pronunciation: /ɪt siːmz tə miː ðæt/ 잇 심즈 투 미 댓

example.B: It seems to me that we underestimated the complexity.

keyPhrases.pronunciation: /aɪ tend tə θɪŋk/ 아이 텐드 투 씽크

example.A: How do you usually approach problems?
example.B: I tend to think about all possibilities before deciding.

keyPhrases.pronunciation: /ɪf juː æsk miː/ 이프 유 애스크 미
keyPhrases.context: 의견을 요청받지 않았지만 말할 때 (다소 직설적)

example.B: If you ask me, we should simplify it first.

keyPhrases.commonMistakes: 비판적인 의견 전에 자주 사용하므로 상대방이 긴장할 수 있음

example.A: What do you think of my presentation?
example.B: To be honest, I think it needs more examples.

keyPhrases.pronunciation: /aɪm əv ði əˈpɪnjən ðæt/ 아임 어브 디 어피니언 댓
keyPhrases.context: 격식 있는 자리에서 의견을 말할 때

example.A: Should we invest in new technology?
example.B: I'm of the opinion that it's essential for our growth.

keyPhrases.pronunciation: /wɒt aɪ miːn ɪz/ 왓 아이 민 이즈
keyPhrases.context: 자신의 의견을 명확히 하거나 설명을 추가할 때

example.A: I'm not sure I understand your point.
example.B: What I mean is that we need to focus on quality, not quantity.

keyPhrases.pronunciation: /aɪ fiːl ˈstrɒŋli ðæt/ 아이 필 스트롱리 댓
keyPhrases.commonMistakes: 너무 자주 사용하면 고집스럽게 보일 수 있음

example.B: I feel strongly that we should prioritize safety.

keyPhrases.pronunciation: /nɒt ˈevriwʌn wʊd əˈɡriː bʌt/ 낫 에브리원 우드 어그리 벗
keyPhrases.context: 논쟁적일 수 있는 의견을 조심스럽게 제시할 때

example.A: What's your opinion on remote work?
example.B: Not everyone would agree, but I think it boosts creativity.
